result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Anthony Rabinek

records.addlTxt: Court re-instates justice point at previous level- LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION. Defendant must report to justice point to get re-established by 11/04/2022 end of business. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Michael Anthony Rabinek appeared by video.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp appeared by video for Michael Anthony Rabinek.  Attorney Amy Spanczak appeared in court on behalf of Abby Rockendorf for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Court addresses Justice Point violation. Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail. Case adjourned for a status conference date to track along with pending matter, before Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services DISCHARGE Report dated October 17, 2022; received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review..
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Michael Anthony Rabinek appeared by video.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp appeared by video for Michael Anthony Rabinek.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr for Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense received discovery; defendant has new case; not in CCAP as of today's date. Defense requested adjournment; court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-15-22

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Michael Anthony Rabinek in court with attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties regarding discovery issues. Court schedules next court date for a Status Conference date, and sets 09/19/2022 deadline for filing any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-2-22
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Defendant Michael Anthony Rabinek in court with Attorney Michael H. Kopp.  Edward O'Brien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Modified Justice Point Pretrial Order signed and initialed  by Commissioner Moore is scanned in.

CORRECTION TO ENTRY ON 6-25-22:  Court ordered Justice Point Supervision Level 3, random drug testing, absolute sobriety, no dangerous weapons or firearms, and no possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Modified Justice Point Pretrial Order scanned in.  Prior $2,500 PR bond ordered remains.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-1-22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Anthony Rabinek in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Michael Anthony Rabinek in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
